root: ^The autopsy report prepared by the ship's doctor stated that Mr. Jenkins died within an hour after consuming his meal. However, Mrs. Jenkins, you claimed that your husband was awake for several hours after dinner.
^Why would you lie about this, Mrs. Jenkins? What are you hiding?
^You did it, Phillip. You're the murderer. You told me that if we got rid of my husband, we could finally be together, that we could live the life we always dreamed of.
^Mrs. Jenkins, were you an accomplice to this crime, or are you a victim as well?
^I didn't know he would actually do it... I didn't know he'd kill him...
^Enough, Mr. Anderson. The truth always finds a way to reveal itself.
^Let's take this from the beginning. Mr. Anderson, you meticulously planned the murder of Mr. Jenkins from the outset.
^It started with the theft of the bottle of poison from young Mr. Jenkins' cabin, a fact he seemed eager to share.
^From that moment, you had your murder weapon.
^You needed an alibi, so you artfully arranged for Captain Bennett to be your witness.
^You requested the maid, Ms. Thompson, to call the chef, Mr. Sullivan, from the kitchen, leaving the place unattended and ripe for your devious plan.
^Slipping into the vacant kitchen, you poisoned the special meal meant for Mr. Jenkins.
^You were in a hurry, a man on a deadly mission, but unfortunately for you and the late steward, she stumbled upon you.
^She wasn't part of your plan, and to ensure she wouldn't unravel your scheme, you had no choice but to kill her.
^In a panic, you left her body at the bottom of the stairs, trying to make it look like an accident.
^A heinous act, and a desperate attempt to cover your tracks.
^After the murder, you went to Mrs. Jenkins. You knew she'd be vulnerable, confused, and more importantly, loyal to you.
^You fed her the story that would cement your alibi, knowing she would stand by you, her lover.
^This is outrageous! I deny all of these false allegations. I did not...
^Guards! Arrest this man immediately. He will be turned over to the police upon reaching the shore.
^You can't do this to me! I demand...
^Your demands mean nothing now. You will face justice for your crimes.
